triples.name: Artificial life
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the concept of artificial life as a new class of organisms that will be designed and will evolve.

triples.name: Evolution
triples.relevance: The paper discusses evolutionary change as a fundamental process that artificial organisms will undergo.

triples.name: Reproduction
triples.relevance: Reproduction is central to the paper's definition of artificial life as organisms that will reproduce and evolve.

triples.name: Lamarckism
triples.relevance: The paper explicitly mentions Lamarckian components in the reproduction of artificial organisms, distinguishing them from natural evolution.

triples.name: Organism
triples.relevance: Organisms are the fundamental entities discussed in the paper as the new class of artificial life forms.

triples.name: Industrial Revolution
triples.relevance: The paper uses the Industrial Revolution as a historical comparison point for the magnitude of impact artificial life may have.

triples.name: Nuclear weapon
triples.relevance: The paper references nuclear weapons as a historical example of transformative events to compare the potential impact of artificial life.

triples.name: Pollution
triples.relevance: Environmental pollution is cited as another major historical challenge whose impact may be surpassed by artificial life.
